message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR 

This paper deals with the task of grounding natural language phrases in images, which involves computer vision (CV) and natural language processing (NLP). The proposed method involves extending Faster R-CNN, a popular object detection algorithm in CV, to relate image regions and phrases. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) and cs.CL (Computation and Language) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also involves few- and zero-shot detection, which falls under the category of machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI), making cs.LG (Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories as well. Finally, the paper involves techniques for improving the discernment between similar phrases, which involves information retrieval (IR) techniques, making cs.IR (Information Retrieval) a possible sub-category.
